content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple clash that should be solvable for most clashers, but hard enough to be fun for Fastest and Shortest modes.

Please change the units of speed from "km/m" to "km/min". This is the only issue I can see. It's confusing because "m" is reserved for "metres" in physics.

With that fixed, I'm ready to approve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good one

Hi,
An error remains.
You put in the statement: "Did not make it to the finish" when this is expected: "Did not make the trip".

Let me know when you've corrected it so I can convert my reject to an approval if it seems right.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash.

Goal
* Please move all the speeds from Input section to this section, and also mention the words used to represent each mode.

* Please format all the speeds and the modes as {{constants}}, e.g. {{20.58}}, {{SOUND}}.

Input
* Please mention the measurement unit of [[Distance]].

* Please add line numbers in <<bold>>, i.e. <<Line 1>>, <<Line 2>> and <<Next [[n]] lines>> in front of the descriptions.

* Please mention that the transportation mode and the travelling times are space-separated.

* Please mention that [[Time]] is an integer.

Output
* Please format both fixed output phrases as {{constants}}.

* Please fill in the blank ( ____ ) with a variable name and its explanation.

* Please also mention the rounding requirement.

Constraints
* 0 > x < y means both 0 and y are greater than x. That is not your intended meaning, as 0 should be **less** than x. Hence, please change ">" to "<" in all three constraints.

* Please change the upper limit of n to something more reflective of the actual cases, e.g. 10.

Thanks.
Updated, if there is anything else to fix I'll gladly take the help.
I have fixed it, somehow I didn't notice the first few times. Thank you for noticing.
I have fixed them, thanks for noticing.

Thank you for following up. Below are my comments on the revised version:

Goal
* Please format “LIGHT”, “SOUND”, “MOTO”, “SWIM” and “WALK” as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Input
* Line 1: Please mention that the distance is an integer.

* Please delete “Line 3The type of transportation Transportation”.

* Next n lines: Please fix the typo: “interger” => “integer”.

Output
* Please change the first line as:
{{Overshot by }}[[overshot]] if you go past the finish line, where [[overshot]] refers to the distance that you overshot the end goal, rounded to one decimal place

Thanks again.
Updated again, once more if there is anything that needs fixing still I will gladly fix. And sorry for all the grammar/spelling mistakes.
No worries. It looks ok now.
Can you upvote perhaps? I am pretty sure that I am done this one as well now.

The statement does not mention what should be done if there is no overshooting (i.e. the trip is made exactly). There aren't such cases either. Please consider expanding the statement and the cases.

Thanks.
I added 2 test cases with that type of answer. Now? :)

The last constraint is violated by some of the new cases. Please change the last constraint to:
0<[[time]]≤100

(Notice the second sign is changed to ≤.)

Are you going to change the same thing for your other contribution?

Thanks.
I updated that now, and yes I will make that change to the other one.
